laboratory_examinations.findings: Peak sodium current amplitude was markedly reduced in DN/H and DN/DN mice compared with H/H littermates. Late sodium current was increased in DN/DN mice compared with DN/H and H/H littermates.

3_weeks.heart_rate: 388 ± 68 bpm for H/H; 354 ± 68 bpm for DN/H; 335 ± 61 bpm for DN/DN
3_weeks.P_wave_duration: 13.0 ± 0.6 ms for H/H; 17.0 ± 0.3 ms for DN/H; 19.4 ± 0.5 ms for DN/DN
3_weeks.PR_interval: 33.7 ± 0.7 ms for H/H; 35.6 ± 0.7 ms for DN/H; 44.1 ± 0.9 ms for DN/DN
3_weeks.QRS_duration: 9.8 ± 0.2 ms for H/H; 11.8 ± 0.3 ms for DN/H; 22.3 ± 2.2 ms for DN/DN
3_weeks.QT_interval: 48.5 ± 1.9 ms for H/H; 50.2 ± 1.1 ms for DN/H; 67.6 ± 4.2 ms for DN/DN

12_weeks.heart_rate: 387 ± 68 bpm for H/H; 368 ± 611 bpm for DN/H; 317 ± 618 bpm for DN/DN
12_weeks.P_wave_duration: 14 ± 0.5 ms for H/H; 18.6 ± 0.3 ms for DN/H; 27.1 ± 1.2 ms for DN/DN
12_weeks.PR_interval: 37.8 ± 0.8 ms for H/H; 39.7 ± 0.7 ms for DN/H; 57.1 ± 3.1 ms for DN/DN
12_weeks.QRS_duration: 10.7 ± 0.4 ms for H/H; 12.9 ± 0.3 ms for DN/H; 33.4 ± 2.7 ms for DN/DN
12_weeks.QT_interval: 51.2 ± 0.6 ms for H/H; 54.8 ± 0.8 ms for DN/H; 77.9 ± 3.7 ms for DN/DN

laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: The prolongation of the P-wave duration, PR interval, and QRS duration associated with the DN allele was progressive with age.

There was consistent and statistically significant end-diastolic and end-systolic left ventricular dilatation and calculated left ventricular fractional shortening reduction in a gene-dose-dependent fashion.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Western blotting showed a reduction in sodium channel protein abundance associated with the DN allele, which was more dramatic in DN/DN compared with DN/H hearts.
Real-time polymerase chain reaction showed that SCN5A transcript levels were elevated in mice with the DN allele.
